projects.title: Bachelor Thesis
projects.desc: An Artificial Neural Network based adaptive non-linear control strategy, with highlight on its capability as a compliant control scheme. The thesis involved simulation and control design, mechanical and PCB design, with custom embedded software.

projects.title: Vincent™
projects.desc: An AI system that turns sketches into art. It utilises a GAN architecture to mimic human creativity and imagination.

projects.title: Master Thesis
projects.desc: Dynamic Gain Scheduling control for the Bixler aircraft in highly non-linear flight conditions. The project included simulation and control design, custom sensor design and integration and software implementation on the on-board flight controller.

projects.title: Electric hokey cart
projects.desc: An electric wheelchair for disabled people to play indoor hokey. I worked on the control system, embedded controller and the power-electronics.

projects.title: Deepray™
projects.desc: An AI system that reconstructs highly distorted images in real-time. Using a GAN it can go beyond simple image restoration when huge amount of information is lost. It is able to fill up missing details in a context aware way that it learnt from the training dataset.

projects.title: Internship at DroneX
projects.desc: I worked on control algorithms and software for drones and bipedal systems. Also, I had the chance to experience working in a dynamic start-up environment.

projects.title: Multidisciplinary optimisation
projects.desc: A satellite coverage project that involved a multi-step design process with optimisation in each step to get the best possible coverage for the given constraints.

projects.title: EMICAB
projects.desc: EMICAB was an international collaborative research project to develop a hexapod robot. I was working on a novel tactile sensitive fingertip design for the legs.

projects.title: Drone simulation
projects.desc: A simulation environment in Gazebo with the corresponding controller in Simulink communicating over ROS. It was developed for the IMAV 2017 student competition.

projects.title: The kidnapped robot
projects.desc: A project to address the kidnapped robot problem, involving autonomous localisation and mapping in an uncertain environment.

projects.title: Robot kinematics and dynamics
projects.desc: Simulation and control for several different robotic arm configurations.

projects.title: Stepladder climber
projects.desc: A university project to build a robot that can climb a stepladder with very tight size and weight constraints.
